== MY CONTRIBUTIONS ==

I focus on taking care of Universe in general, and in particular of the packages I have either introduced or somehow adopted.
I usually check new bugs as they are <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.searchtext=&orderby=-datecreated&search=Search&field.status%3Alist=NEW&assignee_option=any&field.assignee=&field.bug_reporter=&field.bug_supervisor=&field.bug_commenter=&field.subscriber=&field.component=4&field.component=3&field.component-empty-marker=1&field.status_upstream-empty-marker=1&field.omit_dupes.used=&field.omit_dupes=on&field.has_patch.used=&field.has_cve.used=&field.tag=&field.tags_combinator=ANY&field.has_no_package.used=|filed]]</nowiki>, fixing <nowiki>[[http://qa.ubuntuwire.org/|Q/A issues]]</nowiki> or <nowiki>[[http://dad.dunnewind.net/universe.php|syncing/merging]]</nowiki>.

To this date (27 September 2008) I have 164 commits to Intrepid and 127 to Hardy (mostly bug fixes).

Beside the packages I introduced to Ubuntu (see below) I also have adopted some packages which I particularly follow:

conky, xchat-xsys, source-highlight and the R suite

I've recently been involved with the <nowiki>[[DesktopTeam|desktop team]]</nowiki> where I contributed some bug triaging and updates.
As part of this I have set up a <nowiki>[[http://norsetto.890m.com/desktop_packages.php|page]]</nowiki> which collects daily the last version of all desktop packages from Ubuntu, Debian and Upstream.
The scripts used are licensed under the GPL and are available <nowiki>[[https://code.launchpad.net/~norsetto/+junk/main|here]]</nowiki>.

I'm also part of the <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~motu-release|motu-release team]]</nowiki> and as such have the pleasant role of taking care of approving or denying Feature Freeze exceptions for Universe and Multiverse.

I have contributed some of my packages back to <nowiki>[[http://qa.debian.org/developer.php?login=norsetto@ubuntu.com|Debian]]</nowiki>, where I co-maintain or maintain them.

Finally, I'm in the <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~sru-verification|sru-verification team]]</nowiki>, where I help with the verification of stable request updates, mainly for universe packages and for the current release.
